Resource Guide: Understanding and Responding to Scams

Immediate Actions to Take If You Fall Prey to Scams

Contact Your Bank: Immediately inform your bank if your account or credit card details are compromised to prevent further losses.

File a Police Report: You can do this online or in person. For urgent police assistance, call '999'.

Notify Affected Parties: Alert all contacts and service providers if your online account is compromised. Change your password and enable two-factor or multi-factor authentication if possible.

Report the Scam:

Share scam-related information with the Police at 1800 255 0000.

Report your scam encounters on social media or communications platforms to platform administrators.

What to Expect After Reporting a Scam

Police Investigation Timeline:

The duration of a police investigation into scams varies based on the scam type, the scammer's tactics, and if the money was transferred overseas.

The Investigation Officer (IO) will update you on significant case developments. Contact your IO if you haven't heard anything in the last six months. For urgent issues, call '999'.

Recovery of Funds:

Recovering funds, especially those transferred overseas, is often challenging due to jurisdictional and legal complexities.

The chances of recovery diminish significantly once funds leave Singapore.

Legal and Supportive Measures:

Consider civil recourse for additional recovery options.

A Victim Care Officer (VCO) can provide emotional and practical support during the investigation and court processes.

Where to Seek Support

Emotional and Psychological Support:

Institute of Mental Health Helpline: 6389 2222 (24-hour hotline)

Singapore Association for Mental Health: 1800 283 7019

Samaritans of Singapore: 1800 221 4444 (24-hour hotline)

Silver Ribbon (Counselling): 6386 1928

Financial Assistance:

Ministry of Social and Family Development: Call the ComCare hotline at 1800 222 0000 for assistance with basic needs.

Tips to Strengthen Your Protection Against Scams

Install and Utilize Protective Apps: ScamShield App, Anti-Virus App, and enable International Call Blocking.

Use Strong Authentication: Implement two or multi-factor authentication for all sensitive accounts.

Stay Informed and Alert: Regularly visit the ScamAlert website and discuss scam trends with loved ones.

Seek Advice: When unsure, consult the NCPC Anti-Scam Helpline at 1800-7226688 or use the ScamShield WhatsApp Chatbot.
